page.title: 19Outside Activities
page.content: We have two Brownie Packs in Hutton Rudby. Mrs.Truscott runs one and Mrs.Baker runs the other. This summer we have been doing a play. We came second in the Brownie revels. Guides are held on Fridays. It started in 1910 by Lady Baden Powell. The guides go to camp and also do a concert every year, for the old people. Cubs are run by Mr.Isles and Mr.Fortune. The ages are from 8yrs. to 11yrs. They meet weekly in Church House. The Cubs work hard for badges, probably the hardest one is the Gold Arrow which only 3 or 4 boys have got. Scouts meet once a week too in the same building. There used to be 50 in the pack but now they have split up into 2 groups, one in Hutton and one in Swainby. Mr.Rainer and Mr.Parker are the leaders.
